page.title: 09WILDLIFE
page.content:
The woodlands and farmland of Clifton Hampden support a great variety of wildlife. Many different kinds of birds can be seen including nightingales, treecreepers, nuthatches and the greater spotted woodpecker. There are also woodcock, pheasant and partridge as some of the woodland is still managed for shooting.
When the Nuneham Estate was owned by the Harcourt family it was very much kept for sporting activities. Herds of both monkjack and fallow deer are a reminder of those times.
To the north of Clifton Heath there are disused brick pits which provide a wet marshy habitat for newts, frogs, moorhens and other marsh dwellers.
